display: We've got a lot of work to do here... This is the fresh install of Raspberry Pi OS on my Pi 5 that is taking over for a previous boot disk with a different OS installation.. You ned to take all the stored information, configurations, tools, settings and responsibilities outlined in the github repositories and begin the process of establishiung this new install as the one ion charge

ultrathink Welcome to the new operating system on the same hardware... we need to get to work migrating everything over
I've reinserted the prior MicroSD so you can copy over ssh keys and configs
!pwd
!pwd
!pwd
proceed

colab-config isn't present yet, but I would actually kind of like dotfiles to work a little diferently from here on out.. could we please clone it into the most direct and universally cluster-wide location for simplicity? even though it is setup as a sub-module here and in colab-config, I feel like it would be cool to use the suggested method you can install chezmoi and your dotfiles from your GitHub dotfiles repo on a new, empty machine with a single command:

sh -c "$(curl -fsLS get.chezmoi.io)" -- init --apply $GITHUB_USERNAME and use the https://github.com/IMUR/dotfiles directly in there git@github.com:IMUR/dotfiles.git, Set up a new machine with a single command
You can install your dotfiles on new machine with a single command:

chezmoi init --apply https://github.com/$GITHUB_USERNAME/dotfiles.git
If you use GitHub and your dotfiles repo is called dotfiles then this can be shortened to:

chezmoi init --apply $GITHUB_USERNAME
Hint

Private GitHub repos require other authentication methods:

chezmoi init --apply git@github.com:$GITHUB_USERNAME/dotfiles.git

we are not checking what is in place, we are conceptualizing an improved management plan
